name: Bring Your Own Blood Trivia Quiz | Literature: Something in Common | 10 Questions

questions.text: "Dragon's Blood" is the first novel in a series by Jane Yolen; it also happens to be one of my favorite books of all time.  But what series is "Dragon's Blood" and "Heart's Blood" in?
questions.explanation:
Pit Dragon Series.

	Jane Yolen's "Pit Dragon Trilogy" begins with "Dragon's Blood", which was released in 1982.  The second, released in 1984, was called "Heart's Blood".  Next in the series was 1987's "A Sending of Dragons". Does anyone else find it odd that in 2009, a FOURTH novel was written for this TRILOGY, entitled "Dragon's Heart"?

questions.text: "The Half-Blood Prince" happens to be the sixth novel in a series, but which series by what author is it?
questions.explanation:
J. K. Rowling's "Harry Potter"

	"Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince" was released in 2005 by J. K. Rowling.  It is the sixth novel in the "Harry Potter" series.  The film adaptation of the novel was released in 2009.

questions.text: Though she is more noted for her "In Death" series (using a pseudonym), she did write a novel called "Blood Brothers".  Who is the author?
questions.explanation:
Nora Roberts.

	J. D. Robb is one of the many pseudonyms of author Nora Roberts.  Her "In Death" series (written as J. D. Robb) is one of her most popular.  However, in 2007, Roberts released the first of a trilogy, and it was called "Blood Brothers".

questions.text: John Sandford wrote a novel called "Bad Blood".  In which of his series does this title belong?
options: None of these; it's stand alone
questions.explanation:
Virgil Flowers Series.

	John Sandford is perhaps the most well known for his "Prey" series.  However, "Bad Blood" was released in 2010, and was the fourth in John Sandford's (not to get confused with John Sanford) "Virgil Flowers" series.

questions.text: Of course, what blood quiz is complete without a question about vampires?  Who authored the "Blue Bloods" series?
questions.explanation:
Melissa De la Cruz.

	Melissa De la Cruz wrote the vampire novels in the "Blue Bloods" series.  The first in the series was titled "Blue Bloods", and was released in 2007.

questions.text: R. L. Stine wrote a novel called "Monster Blood".  It is a novel in a famous series of Stine's.  What is the series known as?
questions.explanation:
Goosebumps.

	"Monster Blood" is the fourth in a long series of novels by R. L. Stine.  The series is "Goosebumps", a horror series for children.  "Monster Blood" was written in 1992, but was not the first.  There was also "Monster Blood II", "III", "IV", and "Monster Blood for Breakfast!"

questions.text: "Blood Work" is a novel by the man who wrote "The Lincoln Lawyer" as well.  Who is the famous Michael?
questions.explanation:
Michael Connelly.

	Michael Connelly is well known for his Mickey Haller series, the first of which was "Lincoln Lawyer" (2005).  It was made into a film in 2011.  However, "Blood Work" is a bit less famous.  It is not part of one of Connelly's famous series, and was written in 1998.

questions.text: Anne Rice is well known as the author of the "Interview With a Vampire" series.  But which of these is actually a name of a novel in this series?
questions.explanation:
Blood and Gold.

	"Blood and Gold" was written in 2001 by Anne Rice.  It is in the Vampire Chronicles series, the first of which was the famous "Interview with a Vampire" (1976).  "Interview with a Vampire" was made into a movie in 1994.

questions.text: Clive wrote a series of novels called "Books of Blood".  Which of these Clives wrote it?
questions.explanation:
Clive Barker.

	Clive Barker wrote the horror series "Books of Blood" in six volumes.  All six volumes were released between 1984 and 1985.  In the United States, however, volumes 4-6 were published under different titles.

questions.text: "Days of Blood and Fire" is one of the many novels in the Deverry Cycle.  Who is the author of this series?
questions.explanation:
Katharine Kerr.

	Katharine Kerr wrote the first of the Deverry series in 1986.  It was called "Daggerspell".  "Days of Blood and Fire" was released in 1993.  It was known as "A Time of War" in the UK.  It was the third book of Act II in the Deverry series.
